label: 菩提僊那, 菩提仙那
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Bodhisena (Sk.). Indian monk who came to Japan in 736, and who was well received in the officially recognized Buddhist community.  He was appointed archbishop (sōjō) in 751, and led the eye-opening ceremony at unveiling of the great Vairocana Buddha image at Tōdaiji in 752.
